commands.name: az network public-ip prefix create
commands.summary: Create a public IP prefix resource.
commands.syntax:
az network public-ip prefix create --name
                                   --resource-group
                                   [--custom-ip-prefix-name]
                                   [--edge-zone]
                                   [--ip-tags]
                                   [--length]
                                   [--location]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--tags]
                                   [--tier {Global, Regional}]
                                   [--version {IPv4, IPv6}]
                                   [--zone]
examples: az network public-ip prefix create --length 28 --location westus2 --name MyPublicIPPrefix --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network public-ip prefix delete
commands.summary: Delete a public IP prefix resource.
commands.syntax:
az network public-ip prefix delete [--ids]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--subscription]
examples: az network public-ip prefix delete --name MyPublicIPPrefix --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network public-ip prefix list
examples: az network public-ip prefix list --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network public-ip prefix show
commands.summary: Get the details of a public IP prefix resource.
examples: az network public-ip prefix show --name MyPublicIPPrefix --resource-group MyResourceGroup --subscription MySubscription

commands.name: az network public-ip prefix update
commands.summary: Update a public IP prefix resource.
commands.syntax:
az network public-ip prefix update [--add]
                                   [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--ids]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--remove]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--set]
                                   [--subscription]
                                   [--tags]
examples: az network public-ip prefix update --name MyPublicIPPrefix --resource-group MyResourceGroup --set useRemoteGateways=true

commands.name: az network public-ip prefix wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
